content: Recommended for all open combat wounds if able to take PO meds and Moxifloxacin unavailable.

Nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain, dizziness, insomnia, somnolence, dyspepsia, fever, dyspnea, rash, abnormal transaminases, headache, arthralgia, muscle weakness, hypersensitivity reactions, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, erythema nodosum, blurred vision, tinnitus, bad taste

BCG vaccine (live), buprenorphine, cholera vaccine, clarithromycin, clomipramine, clozapine, desflurane, hydroxychloroquine, imipramine, iron sucrose, isoflurane, mefloquine, olanzapine, theophylline, tizanidine, tretinoin

TACTICAL CONSIDERATIONS: Minimal to no mission impact unless CNS side effects observed. Monitor for CNS side effects including dizziness, seizures, hallucinations, agitation, paranoia, and suicidal ideations; discontinue use if encountered. Minimize caffeine intake due to interference with ciprofloxacin. Administer 2 hours before or 6 hours after substantial calcium intake due to decreased absorption.
